author: Jo Craven McGinty
title: Measuring Success, One-Thousandth of a Second at a Time
text:
To capture each launch, finish and point of the Pyeongchang Winter Olympics, Omega, the official timekeeper, has deployed 300 employees, supplied 230 tons of equipment and enlisted the help of 350 volunteers.
By the time the games conclude on Feb. 25, the Swiss watch manufacturer will have recorded roughly 800,000 times, distances and other readings for nearly 3,000 athletes over 19 days.
“Everything... RELATED VIDEO The Trick That’s Changing Men’s Figure Skating Quadruple jumps were once considered a rare acrobatic feat, but they have become all but necessary in men’s figure skating. Olympians Adam Rippon and Vincent Zhou explain what quads mean for the sport. Photo composite: Heather Seidel
